com.kevalpatel2106.emoticongifkeyboard

Class EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.kevalpatel2106.emoticongifkeyboard.EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentCallbacks, FragmentManager.OnBackStackChangedListener, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public final class EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment
extends Fragment
implements FragmentManager.OnBackStackChangedListener
    This Fragment will host the smiles and gifs. Add this fragment into your view of activity or fragment.
    Author:
    'https://github.com/kevalpatel2106'

    • Method Detail

      • getNewInstance

        public static EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment getNewInstance(@NonNull
                                                         View container,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.EmoticonConfig emoticonConfig,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.GIFConfig gifConfig)
        Get the new instance of EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment. Call this method to get repairable instance of fragment instead of directly calling constructor. Set the emoticon and GIF configurations in this function. You can also disable either emoticon or GIF functionality by passing EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.EmoticonConfig null or EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.GIFConfig null respectively. At least one functionality should be non null.
        Parameters:
        container - Container view that encloses the EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.
        emoticonConfig - EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.EmoticonConfig with emoticon configurations. If this parameter is null emoticon listing and emoticon search functionality will be disabled.
        gifConfig - EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.GIFConfig with GIF configurations. If this parameter is null GIF listing and GIF search functionality will be disabled.
        Returns:
        EmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment

      • handleBackPressed

        public boolean handleBackPressed()
        Handle the back key pressed event. Implement this method to Activity.onBackPressed() of your activity.

        Sample: public void onBackPressed() {
        if (mEmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment == null || !mEmoticonGIFKeyboardFragment.handleBackPressed())
        super.onBackPressed();
        }

        Returns:
        True if the back press event is handled by this method. Else it will false.

      • setEmoticonProvider

        public void setEmoticonProvider(@Nullable
                                EmoticonProvider emoticonProvider)
        Set the EmoticonProvider to render different images for unicode. If the value is null, system emoticon images will render.
        Parameters:
        emoticonProvider - EmoticonProvider for custom emoticon packs or null to use system emoticons.
        See Also:
        EmoticonProvider
